newsitem.title: UK: Nationwide profits slide in year.
newsitem.headline: Nationwide profits slide in year.

text.p: Britain's Nationwide Building Society, Britain's largest building society following the flotation of Halifax Plc, said on Wednesday that annual pretax profits fell 33 percent to 264.8 million pounds ($433.5 million).
It said in a statement that group operating profit before provisions and tax fell to 314.3 million pounds in the year to April 4, 1997 from last year's 520.4 million pounds.

"This is excellent news for Nationwide customers and underlines the commitment made last year to give back 200 million pounds ($327.4 million) to customers through better rates," said chief executive Brian Davis.
On the lending front, Nationwide said that mortgage lending advances increased by 51 percent to 6.5 billion pounds during the year.

The Nationwide is committed to maintaining its mutual status despite the recent rash of building societies rushing to lose this tag. The most recent of these was the Halifax, which floated on the London Stock Exchange last week.
The building society said that "without the burden of shareholder dividends or the need to maintain a share price, it can afford to offer a superior mortgage and savings rates to customers."
